item.title: Ted Underwood and Kevin Kiley and Wenyi Shang and Stephen Vaisey

item.description:
Hello! I am Kevin Kiley. I am currently a postdoctoral scholar in the Department of Sociology and Anthropology at North Carolina State University. I received my Ph.D. in sociology in 2021 from Duke University. Here is my CV.

My research explores the cultural and cognitive sources of attitude and opinion stability and change over the life course and develops new methods for measuring opinion behavior over time. A central project develops a cultural-cognitive theory of ambivalence and shows that ambivalence is an extremely common opinion behavior. To date, my work has appeared in the American Sociological Review and Sociological Science and has been recognized by the culture section of the American Sociological Association.

Prior to working at NC State, I was a postdoctoral scholar at the University of Iowa, where I worked with Yongren Shi using computational approaches to adjudicate different theories about how the cultures of online communities emerge and change.

If any of this interests you, please reach out: kkiley@ncsu.edu.
